source: ## Set the folder paths

#Set the folder paths so that it can be used later. 
bronze_folder_path = 'abfss://woca-data@asawocastaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/bronze/'
silver_folder_path = 'abfss://woca-data@asawocastaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/silver/'
gold_folder_path = 'abfss://woca-data@asawocastaccdl.dfs.core.windows.net/gold/'

# we do not want it to infere datatypes
# Set the spark config to be able to get the partitioned columns year and month as string
# spark.conf.set("spark.sql.sources.partitionColumnTypeInference.enabled", "false")
## Read the silver data as a dataframe

# Read the silver data to be processed. 
individual_df = spark.read.parquet(f"{silver_folder_path}/Individual")
family_membership_df = spark.read.parquet(f"{silver_folder_path}/FamilyMembership")
family_df = spark.read.parquet(f"{silver_folder_path}/Family")
# Perform Aggregations
# import
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
### What are the individual age groups

# Perform the required aggregations of the total age_group counts
idv_age_grp_cnt_df = individual_df \
                        .select(col('age_group_name').alias('age_groups')) \
                        .groupBy('age_groups') \
                        .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                        .orderBy('counts') \
                        .dropna(how='any') # Drop null values
idv_age_grp_cnt_df.show()
## What are the top ten cities where families hail?

# Perform the required aggregations of the total age_group counts
fam_top_ten_cty_df = family_df \
                        .select(col('city').alias('cities')) \
                        .groupBy('cities') \
                        .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('top_ten')) \
                        .orderBy(col('top_ten').desc()) \
                        .dropna(how='any') \
                        .limit(10)
fam_top_ten_cty_df.show()
## How many individuals have the same family relationship ID?

## joining two tables (Individual and Family Membership)
idv_fam_rship_cnt_df = individual_df \
                    .join(family_membership_df, individual_df.individual_id == family_membership_df.individual) \
                    .select(col('family_relationship')) \
                    .groupBy('family_relationship') \
                    .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                    .orderBy(col('counts').desc()) \
                    .dropna(how='any')
idv_fam_rship_cnt_df.show()
## What is the top five distributions of FamilyMembership in one primary contact?

```
## What is the distribution of individual family membership?
# Joining 3 tables (Individual, Family and Family Membershiop)
# 1st join the Individual table with the Family table
idv_fam_rship_df = individual_df \
                    .join(family_membership_df, individual_df.individual_id == family_membership_df.individual)

# 2nd add the family table to the combination 
idv_fam_rship_fam_df = idv_fam_rship_df \
                    .join(family_df, idv_fam_rship_df.family == family_df.family_id) \
                    .select(col('family_relationship')) \
                    .groupBy('family_relationship') \
                    .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                    .orderBy(col('counts').desc()) \
                    .dropna(how='any')

idv_fam_rship_fam_df.printSchema()
idv_fam_rship_fam_df.show(10)

```
## What is the distribution of individual family membership?
fam_mem_dist = individual_df \
                .join(family_membership_df, individual_df.individual_id == family_membership_df.individual) \
                .groupBy('individual') \
                .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                .select('counts')\
                .distinct() \
                .orderBy(col('counts').desc()) \
                .dropna(how='any')
# fam_mem_dist.show()

from pyspark.sql import Window
fam_prim_cont_df = family_df \
                .join(family_membership_df, family_df.family_id == family_membership_df.family, 'inner') \
                .groupBy(family_df.primary_contact) \
                .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                .select('counts') \
                .distinct()\
                .withColumn('ids', row_number().over(Window.orderBy(col('counts').desc())))\
                .dropna(how='any') \
                .limit(5)

fam_prim_cont_df = fam_prim_cont_df.select('ids', 'counts')
#fam_prim_cont_df = fam_prim_cont_df.withColumn('ids', row_number().over(Window.orderBy(col('counts').desc())))
fam_prim_cont_df.show()

```
fam_prim_cont_df = family_df \
                .join(family_membership_df, family_df.family_id == family_membership_df.family, 'inner') \
                .groupBy(family_df.primary_contact) \
                .agg(count(lit(1)).alias('counts')) \
                .select('counts') \
                .distinct() \
                .orderBy(col('counts').desc()) \
                .dropna(how='any') \
                .limit(5)
fam_prim_cont_df.show()
## What is the top five distributions of individual family membership?

## What is the distribution of individual family membership?
# Joining 3 tables (Individual, Family and Family Membershiop)
# 1st join the Individual table with the Family table
idv_fam_rship_df = individual_df \
                    .join(family_membership_df, individual_df.individual_id == family_membership_df.individual) \
                    .withColumnRenamed('primary_contact', 'primary_contact_2')

#idv_fam_rship_df = idv_fam_rship_df.withColumnRenamed('primary_contact', 'primary_contact_2')

# 2nd add the family table to the combination 
idv_fam_rship_fam_df = idv_fam_rship_df \
                    .join(family_df, idv_fam_rship_df.family == family_df.family_id) \
                    .dropna(how='any')

#idv_fam_rship_fam_df.printSchema()
idv_fam_rship_fam_df.show(3)
## Stop the spark pool once done
mssparkutils.session.stop()
